eng: we also recognise the role of the leader of the inkatha freedom party, inkosi mangosuthu buthelezi, who also called for madiba’s release, as well as that of other political prisoners and the return of exiles.
tsn: re amogela bogolosegolo bagolegwa ba ba maloba ba ba tsereng mosepele go tswa moseja ga mawatle gore ba tle go nna fano helene pastoors, michael dingake go tswa botswana, rre andimba toivo ya toivo wa swapo kwa namibia.

eng: we are grateful for the spirit of family, community and voluntary work that inspires many people to help those most affected by the crisis, through these difficult times.
tsn: maloko a a tlotlegang,re epile pitso ya bonno jwa motlhakanelwa ya maitseboa gore bontsi jwa batho mo nageng, badiri mmogo le bana ba sekolo, bo kgone go nna karolo ya motsi ono.

eng: we have also set ambitious targets for skills development, to produce additional engineers and technicians, and to increase the number of qualified mathematics and science teachers.
tsn: jaaka lo setse lo itse, re itlametse ditlapele tse tlhano:thuto, boitekanelo, tlhabololo ya metsemagae le bonno jwa batho, go tlhama ditiro tse di eletsegang, le go lwantsha bosenyi.

eng: we must also increase the number of youth who enter learnerships in the privateand public sectors.
tsn: go tlaleletsa fa, re tla dira ka natla go tokafatsa boleng jwa pusoselegae, tlhabololo ya dipopotheo lebonno jwa batho.

eng: we have identified the fight against hijacking, business and house robberies, as well as contact crimes such as murder, rape and assault, as top priorities.
tsn: naptosa, sadtu le saou, foo ba neng ba boeletsa boitlamo jwa bona malebana le kgoeletso ya boleng jo bo kwa godimo jwa go ithuta le go ruta go simolola ka 2010. maloko a a tlotlegang,re tlhoka go beeletsa mo basweng go tlhomamisa gore re nna le mophato wa badiri o o nang le bokgoni jwa go tshegetsa kgolo le tlholego ya ditiro.

eng: municipalities must improve the provision of housing, water, sanitation, electricity, waste management and roads.
tsn: se se akaretsa kago le tlhabololo ya dikokelo le ditleliniki, mmogo le tokafatso ya maemo a tiro a badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo.

eng: we held a meeting with mayors and municipal managers last year.
tsn: re utlwanetse bolekane le bankatlhabololo ya borwa jwa aforika, malebana le go tokafatsa bodiredi jwa dikokelo tsa puso mmogo le dikantoro tsa dikgaolo.

eng: it provides an opportunity to recognise the important contribution of the indian community in the fields of labour, business, science, sport, religion, arts, culture and the achievement and consolidation of our democracy.
tsn: maloko a a tlotlegang,re tsweletsa maiteko a rona a go fedisa bomenemene le botsietsi mo tsamaisong ya dithendara mmogo le mo dikopong tsa makwalokgweetso, madi a tlamelo a puso le makwalo ikitsiso gareng ga tse dingwe.

eng: honourable speaker of the national assembly,chairperson of the national council of provinces.
tsn: 13 feb 2014mmusakgotla yo o tlotlegang wa kokoanotheomolao ya bosetšhaba,modulasetulo wa lekgotla la bosetšhaba la diporofense (ncop).

eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop.
tsn: motlatsammusakgotla wa kokoanotheomolao ya bosetšhaba le motlatsamodulasetulo wa ncop.

eng: deputy president of the republic, honourable kgalema motlanthe.
tsn: motlatsamoporesitente wa rephaboliki, motlotlegi kgalema motlanthe.

eng: former deputy president baleka mbethe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary.
tsn: motlatsamoporesitente wa maloba, baleka mbethe,motlotlegi moatlhodimogolo wa rephaboliki, le ditokololo tsotlhe tse di tlotlegang tsa bosiamisi.

eng: honourable ministers and deputy ministers,distinguished premiers and speakers of our provinces.
tsn: ditona le batlatsatona ba ba tlotlegang,ditonakgolo tse di tlotlegang le babusakgotla ba diporofense tsa rona.

eng: chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership.
tsn: modulasetulo wa mokgatlho wa dipusoselegae tsa aforika borwa, le boeteledipele jotlhe jwa pusoselegae.

eng: chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders.
tsn: modulasetulo wa ntlo ya magosi.

eng: heads of chapter 9 institutions.
tsn: ditlhogo tsa ditheo tsa karolo ya bo 9 tsa puso tseo di tshegetsang temokerasi ya molaotheo.

eng: the governor of the reserve bank,leaders from business, sports, traditional, religious and all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps, special and distinguished guests,honourable members,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.
tsn: baeteledipele go tswa kwa maphateng a kgwebo, metshameko, setso, bodumedi le a mangwe otlhe fela,ditokololo tsa ditheo tsa sedipolomate, baeng ba ba kgethegileng e bile ba tlotlega,ditokololo tse di tlotlegang,maaforika borwa ka nna,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.

eng: i wish to thank the presiding officers for this opportunity to speak to the people of south africa, on this occasion of the last state of the nation address, of the fourth democratic administration.
tsn: ke rata go leboga batlhankedi ba tsamaiso ka tšhono eno ya go bua le batho ba aforika borwa, mo tiragalong eno ya puo ya bofelo ya maemo a setšhaba ya puso ya bone ya temokerasi.

eng: i would like to extend our deepest condolences on the passing of the late honourable mr ben skhosana, one of the longest serving and most senior members of this august house and our former minister of correctional services.
tsn: ke rata go fetisa matshediso le kutlobotlhoko ya rona ka go tlhokafala ga motlotlegi ben skhosana, mongwe wa ditokololo tse di dirileng sebaka go gaisa le mongwe wa bagolwane ba ntlo eno e e tlotlegang e bile e kile ya nna tona ya rona ya maloba ya ditirelo tsa kgopololo.

eng: we are truly saddened by his sudden passing.
tsn: re utlwisitswe botlhoko ke go tsamaya ga gagwe go go neng go sa lebelelwa.

eng: sidlulisa ukukhala kwethu emndenini wakhe, nakumholi we ifp ushenge, kanye namalunga onke e-ifp.
tsn: re rata go gomotsa balelapa la gagwe, gammogo le moeteledipele wa ifp, shenge, le ditokololo tsotlhe tsa ifp.

eng: )honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,this is the first state of the nation address to take place in the absence of our founding president, his excellency nelson rolihlahla mandela.
tsn: mmusakgotla yo o tlotlegang,modulasetilo yo o tlotlegang wa ncop,seno ke puo ya ntlha ya maemo a setšhaba e e diragalang re se na le moporesidente wa rona wa ntlha, motlotlegi nelson rolihlahla mandela.

eng: his passing, on the eve of the 20th year of our freedom and democracy,caused untold pain to our people and beyond our borders.
tsn: go tlhokafala ga gagwe, pele fela ga ngwaga wa bo20 wa kgololesego le temokerasi ya rona, go utlwisitse batho ba rona le ba ba kwa ntle ga melelwane ya rona botlhoko jo bo seng kana ka sepe.

eng: we find solace in the knowledge that madiba will live forever be in our hearts, and that we have a duty to take his legacy forward.
tsn: re ikgomotsa ka kitso ya gore madiba o tla nna ka gale a le mo dipelong tsa rona, le gore re na le maikarabelo a go tsweletsa boswa jwa gagwe.

eng: honourable members,our country has produced men and women of distinction, who have provided leadership during trying times.
tsn: ditokololo tse di tlotlegang,naga ya rona e tlhagisitse banna le basadi ba ba gaisang, ba ba tlametseng ka boeteledipele mo dinakong tse di thata.

eng: one such leader was mr moses kotane, former treasurer-general of the anc and former sacp general secretary.
tsn: mongwe wa baeteledipele bao e ne e le rre moses kotane, motsholamatlotlokakaretso wa maloba wa anc le mokwaledikakaretso wa maloba wa mokgatlho wa bokomonese wa aforika borwa.

eng: we are honouredto have his dear wife, mama rebecca kotane, as our special guest this evening.
tsn: re ikutlwa re tlotlegile tota go bo re na le mosadi wa gagwe yo o rategang, mama rebecca kotane, jaaka moeng wa rona yo o kgethegileng maitseboeng ano.

eng: mama kotane turned 102 years old yesterday, and we wish her all the best.
tsn: mama kotane o letse a fetsa dingwaga di le 102 maabane, mme re mo eleletsa tsotlhe tse dintle.

eng: we also pay tribute to the former anc president mr oliver tambo, who kept the torch of freedom alive both at home and abroad during the most difficult times of our struggle.
tsn: gape re tlotla moporesidente wa maloba wa anc, rre oliver tambo, yo a neng a tsweletse go sedimosa lesedi la kgololesego mo gae le kwa moseja ka dinako tse di neng di le thata go gaisa tsa kgaratlho ya rona.

eng: his son, dali and his wife rachel are sharing this occasion with us this evening.
tsn: morwae, dali le mogatse rachel ba na le rona mo maitseboeng ano.

eng: we salute solomon mahlangu, a brave young man who went defiantly to the gallows in 1979 where he was executed at the age of 23. he said: “my blood will nourish the tree that will bear the fruits of freedom.
tsn: re tlotla solomon mahlangu, lekawana le le pelokgale le le neng la kalediwa le ntse le ititeile sefuba ka 1979 koo a bolailweng gona a na le dingwaga di le 23. o rile: "madi a me a tla nontsha setlhare se se tla ungwang maungo a kgololesego.

eng: tell my people that i love them.
tsn: bolelelang batho ba gaetsho gore ke a ba rata.

eng: they must continue the fight’’.
tsn: ba tshwanetse go tswelapele ka ntwa.

eng: we are honoured to host his mother, mama martha mahlangu and her grand-daughter bathabile.
tsn: "re motlotlo go amogela mmaagwe, mama martha mahlangu le setlogolo sa gagwe, bathabile.

eng: the year 2014 also marks the 40th anniversary of the cowardly murder through a parcel bomb, of student leader, abram onkgopotse tiro in 1974 in botswana.
tsn: gape ngwaga wa 2014 o supa segopotso sa bo40 sa polao ya bogatlapa ka sephuthelwana sa bomo, ya moeteledipele wa baithuti, abaram onkgopotse tiro ka 1974 kwa botswana.

eng: we welcome his brother, mogomotsi tiro to this occasion.
tsn: re amogela morwarraagwe, mogomotsi tiro mo tirong eno.

eng: we express the gratitude of the people, for his brother’s selfless sacrifice.
tsn: re tlhagisa ditebogo tsa batho, ka ntlha ya go intsha setlhabelo ga morwarraagwe.

eng: we remember those who died in state-sponsored violence of the 1980s and 1990s in our townships and villages.
tsn: re gopola botlhe ba ba tlhokafetseng ka nako ya dikhuduego tse di neng di etleediwa ke mmuso ka dingwaga tsa bo1980 le 1990 kwa makeišeneng le kwa metseng ya rona ya kwa magaeng.

eng: ms jabu ndlovu, a former shopsteward of the national union of metalworkers of south africa (numsa), was gunned down in 1988 in pietermaritzburg together with her husband jabulani and their son.
tsn: mme jabu ndlovu, moemedi wa maloba wa badiri wa mokgatlho wa bosetšhaba wa badirakatshipi ba aforika borwa, o ne a thuntshiwa ka 1988 kwa pietermaritzburg mmogo le mogatse jabulani le morwa wa bona.

eng: we welcome her daughter luhle and son, sanele, and pay tribute to all families who lost their loved ones, across the political spectrum.
tsn: re amogela morwadie luhle le morwa, sanele, mme re tlotla malapa otlhe a a latlhegetsweng ke baratiwa ba ona, go ralala mekgatlho yotlhe ya sepolotiki.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,we were able to overcome all that pain of the past and build a new society.
tsn: mmusakgotla yo o tlotlegang,modulasetilo yo o tlotlegang wa ncop,re kgonne go fenya kutlobotlhoko eo yotlhe ya maloba le go aga setšhaba se sentšhwa.

eng: we have built strong institutions of democracy.
tsn: re agile ditheo tse di maatla tsa temokerasi.

eng: we buried the undemocratic, unrepresentative, oppressive and corrupt state that was serving a minority.
tsn: re fitlhile mmuso o e neng e se wa temokerasi, o o neng o se na kemedi, o gatelela e bile o le bobodu o o neng o direla ba le mmalwa fela.

eng: we formed a unitary, non-racial, non-sexist democratic state, answerable to and representative of all south africans.
tsn: re tlhamile mmuso wa temokerasi o o kopaneng, o o sa tlhaoleng go ya ka lotso le fa e le ka bong, o o ikarabelang mo baemeding ba maaforika borwa otlhe.

eng: we created a thriving constitutional democracy, with well-functioning arms of the state –the legislature, the executive and the judiciary.
tsn: re na le temokerasi ya molaotheo e e tlhaga, e e nang le maphata a a dirang sentle a mmuso - kgotlapeomolao, bokhuduthamaga le boatlhodi.

eng: we have chapter 9 institutions which support democracy and protect the rights of citizens.¬liberation and democracy have also created space for an active civil society and a free media.
tsn: re na le ditheo tsa karolo ya bo 9 tse di tshegetsang temokerasi le go sireletsa ditshwanelo tsa baagi.

eng: liberation also brought for the first time, the promise of gender equality.
tsn: gape kgololesego e tlisitse la ntlha, tsholofelo ya tekatekano ya bong.

eng: the representation of women in public institutions has increased considerably since the dawn of freedom, and the extension of basic services also benefits women.
tsn: kemedi ya basadi mo ditheong tsa setšhaba e oketsegile thata fa e sa le go simologa kgololosego, mme le katoloso ya ditirelo tsa motheo e ungwela basadi.

eng: all these attributes have made south africa a much better place to live in now than it has ever been.
tsn: dintlha tseno tsotlhe di dirile gore aforika borwa e nne lefelo le le botoka go nna mo go lona ga jaana go feta jaaka e kile ya nna.

eng: however, our country still faces the triple challenge of poverty, inequality and unemployment, which we continue to grapple with.
tsn: fela naga ya rona e sa ntse e lebanwe ke dikgwetlho tse tharo tsa lehuma, go tlhoka tekatekano le botlhokatiro, tse re tswelelang go samagana natso.

eng: dealing with these challenges has become a central focus of all democratic administrations.
tsn: go samagana le dikgwetlho tseno e setse e le ntlha ya botlhokwa ya mebuso yotlhe ya temokerasi.

eng: we elected to focus on five priorities, education, health, the fight against crime and corruption, rural development and land reform as well as creating decent work.
tsn: thuto, boitekanelo, ntwa kgatlhanong le bosenyi le bobodu, tlhabololo ya metseselegae le ntšhwafatso ya naga mmogo le go tlhama ditiro tse di seriti.

eng: we also reorganised the state to improve performance.
tsn: gape re nopotse gore puso e tshwanetse go tokafatsa tiragatso.

eng: we established the national planning commission which produced the landmark national development plan, the country’s socio-economic blueprint and one of the major achievements of this fourth administration.
tsn: re tlhamile khomišene ya maano ya bosetšhaba e e tlhagisitseng leano la tlhabololo la bosetšhaba (ndp), letlhomeso la naga la ikonomi ya loago mme gape e le nngwe ya diphitlhelelo tse dikgolo tsa puso ya bone.

eng: the plan outlines what we should do to eradicate poverty, increase employment and reduce inequality by 2030. our monitoring and evaluation indicates that many services continue to improve.
tsn: leano le tlhagisa se re tshwanetseng go se dira go fedisa lehuma, go oketsa ditiro le gore re bo re fokoditse go tlhoka tekatekano ka 2030. tekolo le tshekatsheko ya rona e supa gore ditirelo di le dintsi di tswelela go tokafala.

eng: for example, social grants and identity documents now take a shorter time to be processed.
tsn: sekai, jaanong go tsaya nako e khutshwane go bona madi a tlamelo le makwaloitshupo.

eng: but many others still require further work.
tsn: fela tse dingwe tse dintsi di sa ntse di tlhoka tiro ntsi.

eng: i will report back on the five priorities, starting with the economy.
tsn: ke tla bega ka ditlapele tse tlhano, ke simolola ka ikonomi.

eng: on average, the economy has grown at 3,2 percent a year from 1994 to 2012 despite the global recession which claimed a million jobs.
tsn: ka kakaretso, ikonomi e godile ka 3.2% ka ngwaga go tloga ka 1994 go ya go 2012 le fa gone go na le kwelotlase ya ikonomi e e bakileng tatlhegelo ya ditiro di le milione lefatshe ka bophara.

eng: working together as government, business, labour and the community sector, we nursed the economy to a recovery.
tsn: ka go dira mmogo jaaka puso, kgwebo, badiri le lephata la baagi, re tataisa ikonomi gore e itharabologelwe.

eng: the national wealth, measured in terms of gdp, has grown to more than 3.5 trillion rand.
tsn: khumo ya bosetšhaba, e e lekanyediwang go ya ka seelosotlhe sa ditlhagisiwa tsa naga (gdp), e godile go ya go feta madi a a kanaka r3.5 ditirilone.

eng: jobs are now being created again.
tsn: jaanong go tlhamiwa ditiro gape.

eng: there are now 15 million people with jobs in the country, the highest ever in our history, and over 650 thousand jobs were created last year, according to stats sa.
tsn: ga jaana go na le batho ba le dimilione di le 15 ba ba nang le ditiro mo nageng, e leng palo e e kwa godimo go gaisa mo hisetoring ya rona, mme ngogola go tlhamilwe ditiro di feta 650 000 go ya ka lefapha la mananepalo la aforika borwa.

eng: this is still not good enough.
tsn: seno se sa ntse se sa kgotsofatse.

eng: the unemployment rate still remains high.
tsn: seelo sa botlhokatiro se sa ntse se le kwa godimo.

eng: youth unemployment in south africa continues to be of concern, as it is throughout the world.
tsn: botlhokatiro jwa bašwa mo aforika borwa bo tswelapele go tshwenya, fela jaaka mo lefatsheng ka bophara.

eng: we are taking a number of measures, including the employment tax incentive act which encourages employers to hire younger workers.
tsn: re tsaya dikgato di le mmalwa, go akarediwa molao wa ditshiamelo tsa lekgetho la bothapi le le rotloetsang bathapi go thapa ba bašwa jaaka badiri.

eng: regulations will be passed to ensure that this does not affect unsubsidized or older workers adversely.
tsn: go tla fetisiwa melawana e e tla netefatsang gore seno ga se ame badiri ba ba sa etleediweng gongwe badiri ba bagolwane bosula.

eng: further measures are contained in the national youth accord that was signed in soweto last april.
tsn: dikgato tse dingwe di mo teng ga tumelano ya bosetšhaba ya bašwa e e saenilweng kwa soweto ngogola ka kgwedi ya moranang.

eng: the expanded public works programme and the community work programme continue to be an effective cushion for the poor and the youth.
tsn: lenaane le le atolositsweng la ditiro tsa setšhaba le lenaane la tiro ya baagi a tswelela go nna tshegetso e e bokgoni ya batlhoki le bašwa.

eng: we have created 3,7 million work opportunities over the past five years.
tsn: re tlhamile ditšhono tsa ditiro di le dimilione di le 3,7 mo dingwageng di le tlhano tse di fetileng.

eng: our people obtain an income and skills from the public works programme, which they use to seek formal employment.
tsn: batho ba rona ba amogela lotseno le bokgoni go tswa mo lenaaneng la ditiro tsa setšhaba, mme ba dirise tseo go batla tiro e e siameng.

eng: cabinet has set a target of 6 million work opportunities from this year to 2019, targeting the youth.
tsn: kabinete e ipeetse seelo sa ditšhono tsa ditiro di le dimilione di le 6 go tloga monongwaga go ya go 2019, go lebeletswe bašwa.

eng: our social assistance programme which now reaches about 16 million people, provides a safety for millions, especially vulnerable children.
tsn: lenaneo la rona la thuso ya loago le ga jaanong le fitlhelelang batho ba ka nna dimilione di le 16, le tlametsa dimilione ka pabalesego, bogolo thata bana ba ba mo matshosetsing.

eng: (many households are benefiting from government grants which are child support grants, pension as well as disability grants.
tsn: malapa a le mantsi a ungwelwa go tswa mo dithusong tsa puso tse e leng thuso ya tlamelo ya bana, phenšene gammogo le thuso ya bogole.

eng: (government will continue paying out these grants because many households highly depend on them since job opportunities are scarce during these trying times of an economic downturn.
tsn: puso e tla tswelela go duela dithuso tseno gonne bontsi jwa magae bo ikaegile ka tsona ka ntlha ya fa ditšhono tsa tiro di se kalo mo nakong eno e e thata ya kwelotlase ya ikonomi.

eng: (these opportunities, which are made available by government, are enabling us to proudly say that we are currently living in a country that is far better compared to the one we lived in before 1994.
tsn: ditšhono tseno tse di dirwang ke puso, di re kgontsha gore re bue ka boipelo gore ga jaana re nna mo nageng e e botoka thata fa e bapisiwa le e re neng re nna mo go yona pele ga 1994. bakaulengwe.

eng: developments in the united states economy have led to a rapid depreciation in the emerging market currencies, including the rand.
tsn: ditiragalo tsa ikonomi ya amerika di bakile kwelotlase e e bonako mo mading a mebaraka e e sa ntseng e tlhagelela, go akarediwa le ranta.

eng: during the course of 2013, the rand depreciated by 17.6 per cent against the us dollar.
tsn: mo tsamaong ya 2013, ranta e wetse tlase ka 17.6% kgatlhanong le dolara ya amerika.

eng: the weaker exchange rate poses a significant risk to inflation and will also make our infrastructure programme more expensive.
tsn: seelo se se bokoa sa thefosanyo se matshosetsi a a boitshegang mo infoleišeneng mme gape se tla dira gore lenaane la rona la mafaratlhatlha le nne tlhotlhwagodimo.

eng: however, export companies, particularly in the manufacturing sector, should take advantage of the weaker rand and the stronger global recovery.
tsn: le gale, ditlamo tse di romelang ntle, bogolo segolo mo maphateng a tlhagiso, di tshwanetse go dirisa ranta e e bokoa le itharabologelo e kgolo ya lefatshe lotlhe.

eng: while we have these difficulties, we know that we can cope with this period of turbulence.
tsn: le fa re na le mathata ano, re a itse gore re ka kgona mo pakeng eno ya dintelo.

eng: we have done so before in the past five years.
tsn: re setse re kile ra dira jalo mo dingwageng tse tlhano tse di fetileng.

eng: we will, in fact, emerge stronger if we do the right things.
tsn: tota, re tla tlhagelela re maatlafetse le go feta fa re ka dira dilo tse di siameng.

eng: we have to work together as government, business and labour to grow our economy at rates that are above 5 per cent to be able to create the jobs we need.
tsn: re tshwanetse go dira mmogo jaaka puso, kgwebo le badiri go godisa ikomomi ka seelo se se kwa godimo ga 5% gore re kgone go tlhama ditiro tse re di tlhokang.

eng: fortunately this collaboration is already taking place.
tsn: ka lesego, tirisanommogo eno e setse e ntse e tsweletse.

eng: it is taking place at nedlac which is one of the key institutions of cooperation in our democracy, between government, business, labour and the community sector.
tsn: e diragala kwa lekgotla la bosetšhaba la tlhabololo ya ikonomi le ya ditiro, e leng sengwe sa ditheo tsa botlhokwa tsa tirisanommogo mo temokerasing ya rona, magareng ga puso, kgwebo, badiri le baagi.

eng: it has taken place as well in engagements that we have been having with the business community.
tsn: e diragetse gape mo dipuisanong tse re nnileng natso le bagwebi.

eng: last year i started engaging business on specific steps that government can take to make it easier to do business in our country.
tsn: mo ngwageng yo o fetileng ke ne ka simolola go buisana le bagwebi ka ga dikgato tse di rileng tse puso e ka di tsayang go nolofatsa go dira kgwebo mo nageng ya rona.

eng: arising out of that process, we have now streamlined regulatory and licensing approvals for environmental impact assessments, water licenses and mining licenses.
tsn: go tswa mo thulaganyong eo, jaanong re rulagantse dithebolo tsa taolo le dilaesense tsa tshekatsheko ya kamego ya tikologo, dilaesense tsa metsi mmogo le dilaesense tsa meepo.

eng: parliament is finalizing amendments to the law to give effect to this very positive development, which will cut to under 300 days, the time it takes to start a mine, from application to final approvals.
tsn: palamente e konosetsa dipaakanyo tsa bofelelo tsa molao gore ntlha eno e e siameng e dirisiwe, mme seo se tla fokotsa nako ya go simolola moepo go ya go malatsi a a ka fa tlase ga 300, go tloga ka go dira kopo go fitlha kwa go rebolweng.

eng: the deputy president of the republic continues to facilitate discussions between government, mining companies and labour.
tsn: motlatsamoporesidente wa rephaboliki o tswelela go gokaganya dipuisano magareng ga puso, ditlamo tsa meepo le badiri.

eng: the purpose is to stabilise industrial relations in this very important sector of our economy.
tsn: maikemisetso ke go tsepamisa dikamano le badiri mo lephateng leno la botlhokwa la ikonomi ya rona.

eng: the process is yielding results.
tsn: seno se ungwa maungo.

eng: strikes in the sector were fewer and shorter last year.
tsn: dikhuduego mo lephateng leno di nnile mmalwa fela mme e bile ga di a tsaya sebaka.

eng: and more importantly, industrial relations processes are taking place in a manner consistent with the law.
tsn: mme sa botlhokwa, dithulaganyo tsa dikamano tsa badiri di diragala ka tsela e e mo molaong.

eng: we have intervened in mining because it is one of our key job drivers.
tsn: re tseregantse mo meepong gonne e le mothapi yo mogolo.

eng: mining employs over half a million people.
tsn: meepo e thapa batho ba feta halofo ya milione.

eng: it is the biggest earner of foreign exchange in our country.
tsn: ke moamogedi yo mogolo wa madi a dinaga tse di kwa ntle mo nageng ya rona.

eng: it also contributes about 20 billion rand directly to the tax revenue.
tsn: gape e tsenya madi a ka nna r20 bilione ka tlhamalalo mo lotsenong lwa lekgetho.

eng: mining also makes a far larger contribution as a buyer of goods and services, and a supplier of inputs to other sectors of our economy and other economies around the globe.
tsn: gape meepo e na le seabe se segolo jaaka moreki wa dithoto le ditirelo, mmogo le motlamedi wa ditshwaelo mo maphateng a mangwe a ikonomi ya rona mmogo le di-ikonomi tse dingwe lefatshe ka bophara.

eng: we are exploring partnerships with stakeholders to address the issue of housing in mining towns.
tsn: re sekaseka tirisanommogo le baamegi go samagana le ntlha ya dintlo kwa ditoropong tse di nang le meepo.

eng: let me also remind mining companies that 2014 is the deadline for them to improve housing and living conditions of mineworkers and to achieve a number of targets.
tsn: nte ke gakolole ditlamo tsa meepo gape gore 2014 ke letlha la bofelo la gore di tokafatse dintlo le seemo sa botshelo sa badiri ba meepo mmogo le go fitlhelela diphitlhelelo tsa bontsi jo bo rileng.

eng: government continues to monitor and enforce compliance on both the company’s social and labour plans and mining charter targets.
tsn: puso e tswelela go ela tlhoko le go netefatsa kobamelo ya diphitlhelelo tsa maano a ditlamo a loago le badiri mmogo le tšhata ya meepo.

eng: fellow south africans,honourable members,other than mining, we had identified five other job drivers in 2009. these are tourism, agriculture, the green economy, infrastructure development and manufacturing.
tsn: maaforika borwa ka nna,ditokololo tse di tlotlegang,kwa ntle ga meepo, re supile maphata a mangwe a matlhano a a ka susumetsang ditiro ka 2009. ona ke bojanala, temothuo, ikonomi e e tala, tlhabololo ya mafaratlhatlha le tlhagiso.

eng: the tourism industry has grown dramatically.
tsn: indaseteri ya bojanala e godile ka tsela e e gakgamatsang.

eng: in 1993, south africa received a mere 3 million foreign visitors.
tsn: ka 1993, aforika borwa e amogetse baeng ba ba tswang kwa ntle ba le dimilione di le tharonyana fela.

eng: by 2012, the figure had grown to 13 million visitors.
tsn: ka 2012, palo eo e ne e godile go fitlha go baeng ba le dimilione di le 13. re tla tswelapele go godisa indaseteri eno, go lebeletswe bokgoni jwa yona jwa go tlhama ditiro.

eng: in 2012 we unveiled the national infrastructure plan, led by the president through the presidential infrastructure coordinating commission.
tsn: ka 2012 re ribolotse leano la bosetšhaba la mafaratlhatlha, le le eteletsweng pele ke moporesidente ka khomišene ya moporesidente ya bogokaganyo jwa mafaratlhatlha.

eng: we have subsequently invested one trillion rand in public infrastructure over the past five years.
tsn: morago ga moo re ne ra beeletsa r1 tirilione mo mafaratlhatlheng a setšhaba mo tsamaong ya dingwageng di le tlhano tse di fetileng.

eng: many of the projects are completed or are nearing completion.
tsn: bontsi jwa diporojeke bo setse bo konoseditswe kgotsa bo gaufi le go konosediwa.

eng: i will mention just a few.
tsn: ke tla nopola di se kae fela.

eng: the rea vaya system in joburg is now used by more than 100 000 gauteng residents.
tsn: tsamaiso ya rea vaya kwa johannesburg ga jaana e dirisiwa ke baagi ba gauteng ba feta 100 000. ditsamaiso tse di tshwanang le tseo di agiwa kwa motsekapa, tshwane, nelson mandela bay, buffalo city, ethekwini le rustenburg.

eng: the country’s harbours and ports have been improved.
tsn: maemelakepe a naga a tokafaditswe.

eng: we have built a 700 kilometre fuel pipeline from durban to gauteng to transport 4 billion cubic litres of petrol, diesel and jet fuel a year.
tsn: re agile mola wa peipi ya lookwane wa dikilomitara di le 700 o o tswang kwa durban go leba gauteng go tsamaisa dibilione di le 4 tsa dikhubiki tsa dilitara tsa peterolo, disele le lookwane la difofane ka ngwaga.

eng: close to 1 500 kilometres of new roads or lanes have been built.
tsn: go agilwe dikilomitara di ka nna 1 500 tsa ditsela tse dintšhwa.

eng: this progress in respect of roads reminds us of those who have served in this government before who wanted the best for the country, such as our former transport minister mr dullar omar.
tsn: tswelelopele eno e e amanang le ditsela e re gakolola ka bangwe ba ba dirileng mo pusong eno ba ba neng ba eleletsa naga ya rona tse di gaisang, go tshwana le tona ya maloba ya dipalangwa rre dullar omar.

eng: his dear wife farieda is one of our guests this evening.
tsn: mosadi wa gagwe yo o rategang ke mongwe wa baeng ba rona maitseboeng ano.

eng: the construction of new rail lines has started in mpumalanga, to ease the pressure off the roads.
tsn: go simolotswe ka kago ya mela e mentšhwa ya seporo kwa mpumalanga, go fokotsa kgatelelo mo ditseleng.

eng: the gautrain project is now fully functional and carries over 1,2 million passengers a month.
tsn: porojeke ya gautrain jaanong e dira ka botlalo mme e rora bapalami ba feta 1,2 milione ka kgwedi.

eng: the passenger rail agency of south africa will spend over 120 billion rand over the next 10 years to buy new trains.
tsn: setlamo sa setheo sa diporo le banamedi sa aforika borwase tla dirisa madi a a fetang r120 bilione mo tsamaong ya dingwageng tse di latelang di le 10, go reka diterena tse dintšhwa.

eng: transnet is implementing its massive 300 billion rand market demand strategy, building much needed transport infrastructure.
tsn: transnet e diragatsa togamaano ya yona e e boitshegang e e lebeletseng tlhokego mo mmarakeng, ya r300 bilione, go aga mafaratlhatlha a a tlhokegang go gaisa a dipalangwa.

eng: to realise the economic potential of the western cape and the west coast, we launched the saldanha industrial development zone and opened two new factories in atlantis.
tsn: go fitlhelela bokgoni jwa ikonomi jwa kapabophirima le lebopo la bophirima, re tlhomile lefelo la tlhabololo ya diindasteri tsa saldanha mme re butse difeme tse dintšhwa di le pedi kwa atlantis.

eng: to improve the water supply, two large new dams were completed, de hoop in limpopo and spring grove in kwazulu-natal, while phase 2 of the lesotho highlands water project is to be launched soon.
tsn: go tokafatsa tlamelo ya metsi, go konoseditswe matamo a magolo a mantšhwa a le mabedi, de hoop kwa limpopo mmogo le spring grove kwa kwazulu-natal, fa legato la 2 la porojeke ya metsi ya lesotho highlands e tla tlhongwa mo bogautshwaneng.

eng: construction is continuing at the new power stations, medupi in limpopo, kusile in mpumalanga and ingula near ladysmith, employing more than 30 000 workers.
tsn: go tsweletswe ka kago ya diteišene tse dintšhwa tsa maatla, medupi kwa limpopo, kusile kwa mpumalanga le ingula gaufi le ladysmith, mme tsona di thapa badiri ba feta 30 000. re tswelela go sekaseka metswedi e mengwe ya maatla, go lepalepana le leano le le kopanetsweng la ditlamelo tsa maatla.

eng: we continue to explore other sources of energy, in line with the integrated resource plan for energy.
tsn: go tlhagisiwa ga peteroliamo, bogolo segolo gase ya šale, go tla fetola selebo sa kgaolo ya karoo mmogo le ikonomi ya aforika borwa.

eng: the development of petroleum, especially shale gas will be a game-changer for the karoo region and the south african economy.
tsn: morago ga go sekaseka matshosetsi le ditšhono, go tla gololwa melawana ya bofelo fa gautshwane mme yona e tla latelwa ke tsamaiso le thebolo ya dilaesense.

eng: we expect to conclude the procurement of nine thousand six hundred megawatts of nuclear energy.
tsn: re solofetse go konosetsa theko ya dimekawate di le 9 600 tsa maatla a nyutlilia.

eng: biofuels manufacturers have been selected and have started work.
tsn: go setse go tlhophilwe batlhagisi ba biofuel mme ba setse ba simolotse go dira.

eng: honourable membersours is indeed a country at work and is a much better place to live in.
tsn: ditokololo tse di tlotlegangruri naga ya rona ke naga e e dirang mme ke lefelo le go leng botoka go nna mo go lona.

eng: we must keep the momentum.
tsn: re tshwanetse go tsweletsa seo.

eng: honourable members,more of our wealth is created through the internet or telecommunication.
tsn: ditokololo tse di tlotlegang,bontsi jwa lehumo la rona le dirwa mo inthaneteng gongwe ka tlhaeletsano ya megala.

eng: a 37 000 kilometres of fibre-optic cable has been laid by the private and public sectors in the past five years.
tsn: go adilwe mogala wa faeba opotiki wa dikilomitara di le 37 000 ke maphata a poraefete le a setšhaba mo dingwageng di le tlhano tse di fetileng.

eng: this will be significantly expanded in the years ahead.
tsn: seno se tla atolosiwa thata mo dingwageng tse di latelang.

eng: we are proud of our successes in science and technology.
tsn: re motlotlo ka katlego ya rona mo go tsa saense le thekenoloji.

eng: the construction of the first telescope of the 64-dish forerunner to the square kilometre array, the meerkat, will be completed in the first quarter of 2014. honourable members,our incentives to boost manufacturing have yielded returns.
tsn: go tla konosediwa kago ya thelesekoupu ya ntlha ya dijana di le 64 fa go lebilwe kwa arei ya sekwere kilometara, e leng meerkat, mo kotareng ya ntlha ya 2014. ditokololo tse di tlotlegang,diketleetso tsa rona tsa go susumetsa tlhagiso di nnile le dipoelo.

eng: the automotive investment scheme that was launched in 2009 has approved a total 3.8 billion rand worth of incentives for about 160 investment projects.
tsn: sekema sa peeletso ya dijanaga se se tlhomilweng ka 2009 se reboletse diketleetso tsa boleng jwa r3.8 bilione go beelediwa mo diporojekeng tsa peeletso di ka nna 160. tsona di tshegetsa ditiro di feta dikete di le 50. ditlamo di tla bo di dira dikoloi, dithekisi mmogo le dibese.

eng: we have stabilised the clothing, textile, leather and footwear sector, which had been shedding jobs.
tsn: re tsepamisitse lephata la diaparo, dikhai, letlalo le ditlhako, le le neng le kgaola ditiro.

eng: several industries have been designated for local content.
tsn: diindaseteri di le mmalwa di rulaganyeditswe go tlhagisa dilo tsa selegae.

eng: these include buses, canned vegetables, clothing, textiles, leather and footwear and other goods.
tsn: tsona di akaretsa dibese, merogo e e mo metemeng, diaparo, dikhai, letlalo, ditlhako mmogo le dithoto tse dingwe.

eng: we have concrete examples of the success of the localisation programme.
tsn: re na le dikai tse di popota tsa katlego ya lenaneo la selegae.

eng: in the past two years alone, more than 20 000 minibus taxis and 330 buses were assembled locally, drawing investment and development to our cities.
tsn: mo dingwageng di le pedi tse di fetileng fela, go agilwe dithekisi di feta 20 000 le dibese di le 330 mo gae, mme seno se ngoketse dipeeletso le tlhabololo mo ditoropong tsa rona.

eng: in the next five years, the state will procure at least 75% of its goods and services from south african producers.
tsn: mo dingwageng di le tlhano tse di latelang, mmuso o tla reka bonnye 75% ya dithoto le ditirelo go tswa mo batlhagising ba aforika borwa.

eng: fellow south africans,we have to work more intensively to develop emerging or black industrialists.
tsn: maaforika borwa ka nna,re tshwanetse go dira ka natla go tlhabolola batlhagisi ba ba tlhagelelang gongwe ba bantsho.

eng: many of the aspirant black industrialists complain about the difficulties they experience in obtaining industrial finance, supplier and retail markets, and technical production support.
tsn: bontsi jwa batlhagisi ba ba simololang ba bantsho ba ngongorega ka mathata a ba a itemogelang go bona matlole a tlhagiso, mebaraka ya batlamedi le bareki, mmogo le tshegetso ya setegeniki ya tlhagiso.

eng: the national empowerment fund, the industrial development corporation and the small enterprise finance agency will continue to provide finance to viable black-owned businesses to promote industrialisation.
tsn: letlole la bosetšhaba la maatlafatso, koporasi ya tlhabololo ya indaseteri le setheo sa matlole sa dikgwebopotlana, di tla tswelela go tlamela dikgwebo tse di kgonegang tsa bantsho ka matlole go tsweletsa diindasteri.

eng: in addition, we encourage established businesses to support the development of black industrial businesses.
tsn: go tlaleletsa foo, re rotloetsa dikgwebo tse di godileng go tshegetsa tlhabololo ya dikgwebo tsa tlhagiso tsa bantsho.

eng: agriculture is a key job driver and a provider of opportunities for entrepreneurship.
tsn: temothuo ke mothapi yo mogolo le motlamedi wa ditšhono tsa bogwebi.

eng: our agricultural support programme, fetsa tlala, is producing brand new exporters.
tsn: lenaane la rona la tshegetso ya temothuo, fetsa tlala, le tlhagisa baromelantle ba bantšhwa.

eng: the first 88 smallholder farmers in this programme supplied the united nations world food programme with 268 tons of maize and beans to send to lesotho last month.
tsn: balemirui ba ntlha ba ba potlana ba le 88 ba ba mo lenaaneng leno ba tlametse lenaane la dijo la lefatshe la ditšhabakopano ka ditone di le 268 tsa mmidi le dinawa gore di romelwe kwa lesotho mo kgweding e e fetileng.

eng: we expect this number to increase.
tsn: re solofetse gore palo eno e oketsege.

eng: we will continue to promote our fisheries sector as well, which contributes an estimated 6billion rand to the economy and provides 27 000 jobs.
tsn: re tla tsweletsa le lephata la rona la botshwaratlhapi, le le tsenyang madi a a fopholediwang go r6 bilione mo ikonoming mme le tlamela ka ditiro di le 27 000. ditokololo tse di tlotlegang,re nnile le tswelelopele e e bonalang mo lenaaneng la ntšhwafatso ya naga.

eng: since 1994, nearly 5,000 farms, comprising 4.2 million hectares, have been transferred to black people, benefiting over 200,000 families.
tsn: fa e sale go tloga ka 1994, dipolase di ka nna 5 000 tsa diheketara di le dimilione di le 4.2, di fetiseditswe kwa bantshong, mme di ungwetse malapa a feta 200 000. ditleleimi tsa mafatshe di ka nna 80 000, tsa boleng jwa diheketara di le dimilione di le 3.4, di setse di konoseditswe mme batho ba le dimilione di le 1.8 ba ungwetswe foo.

eng: the next administration will need to take forward a number of policy, legislative and practical interventions, to further redress the dispossession of our people of their land.
tsn: tsamaiso e e latelang e tla tshwanelwa ke go tsweletsa pele dipholesi di le mmalwa, ditsereganyo tsa peomolao le tiragatso go tswelela go samagana le go tseelwa lefatshe ga batho ba rona.

eng: these include matters relating to the establishment of the office of the valuer-general and thereby opening of the lodgement of claims.
tsn: seno se akaretsa dintlha tse di amanang le go tlhamiwa ga kantoro ya molekanyetsikakaretso mme ka go rialo go bulelwa go tsenngwa ga dikopo tsa ditleleimi.

eng: honourable memberssouth africa is indeed a much better place to live in.
tsn: ditokololo tse di tlotlegangruri aforika borwa ke lefelo le le botoka go nna mo go lona.

eng: let me now report on our social transformation programme.
tsn: nte jaanong ke bege ka lenaneo la rona la ntšhwafatso ya loago.

eng: education is a ladder out of poverty for millions of our people.
tsn: thuto ke sediriswa sa go tswa mo lehumeng go dimilione tsa batho ba rona.

eng: we are happy therefore that there is a huge increase in the enrolment of children in school, from pre-primary to tertiary level.
tsn: ke ka moo re itumeletseng gore go na le koketsego e e boitshegang ya kwadiso ya bana kwa sekolong, go tloga ka dithuto tsa pele ga poraemari go ya kwa legatong la dithuto tse dikgolwane.

eng: the number of children attending grade r has more than doubled, moving from about 300 thousand to more than 700 thousand between 2003 and 2011. a draft policy framework towards universal access to grade r has been gazetted for public comment, with a view to making grade r compulsory.
tsn: palo ya bana ba ba tsenang mophato wa r e menagane go feta gabedi, e tswa go bana ba ka nna 300 000 go ya go feta 700 000 magareng ga 2003 le 2011. letlhomeso la pholisitlhomo le le lebeletseng phitlhelelo e e akaretsang ya mophato wa r le mo kaseteng gore batho ba tshwaele mo go lona, ka maitlhomo a go dira gore mophato wa r o tsengwe ke bana botlhe.

eng: bakwethu,izingane ezingu 8 million azikhokhiesikoleni, kantiezingu 9 million ithola ukudla okunempilo ezikoleni okuphuma kuhulumeni, ukuze zifunde kahle zingabulawa indlala.
tsn: bagaetsho,bana ba le dimilione di le 8 ga ba duele kwa sekolong, mme ba le dimilione di le 9 ba amogela dijo tse di itekanetseng kwa sekolong go tswa mo pusong, gore ba ithute sentle ba sa tshwarwa ke tlala.

eng: (eight million learners are attending no-fee schools, whereas nine million learners are getting nutritious meals at school, which are provided by government to ensure that they do not suffer from starvation and that enables them to perform well.
tsn: seelo sa go falola materiki se tlhatlhogile go tswa go ka nna 61% ka 2009 go ya go ka nna 78% ngogola mme diphalolo tse di letlang dithuto tsa dikirii di tokafala ngwaga le ngwaga.

eng: through the annual national assessments, we keep track of improvements and interventions needed, especially, in maths and science.
tsn: ka ditlhatlhobo tsa ngwaga le ngwaga tsa bosetšhaba, re ela tlhoko ditokafalo le ditsereganyo tse di tlhokegang, bogolo segolo mo dipalong le saense.

eng: to promote inclusivity and diversity, the south african sign language curriculum will be offered in schools from next year, 2015. we have increased our numbers of literate adults through the kha ri gude programme from 2,2 million in 2008 to 3 million people.
tsn: go tsweletsa go akaretsa le go nna le dipharologano, go tla rutwa kharikhulamo ya puo ya diatla ya aforika borwa kwa dikolong, go tloga mo ngwageng o o tlang wa 2015. re okeditse palo ya rona ya bagolo ba ba kgonang go buisa le go kwala ka lenaane la kha ri gude go tloga go dimilione di le 2,2 ka 2008 go ya go batho ba le dimilione di le 3. gape re beeleditse mo katisong ya barutabana mme re bula gape dikholetšhekatiso tsa barutabana go fitlhelela tlhokego.

eng: we have also been investing in teacher training and are re-opening teacher training colleges to meet the demand.
tsn: go tlhagisa tikologo e e nang le seriti ya go ithutela, re agile dikolo tse dintšhwa di le 370, go tsena mo legatong la dikolo tsa mmu mmogo le tsa dikago tse dingwe tse di neng di sa siama go ralala naga.

eng: the programme continues.
tsn: lenaane leo le tswelela pele.

eng: compatriotswe have a good story to tell in higher education as well.
tsn: bakaulengwere ka tlotla kgang e e monate le ka tsa thuto e kgolwane.

eng: student enrolments at universities increased by 12% while further education and training college enrolments have increased by 90%.
tsn: ikwadiso ya baithuti kwa diyunibesithi e oketsegile ka 12% fa ikwadiso ya dikholetšhe tsa thuto le katiso e e tswelelang (fet) e oketsegile ka 90%.

eng: we have increased the budgets of the national student financial aid scheme to 9 billion rand to meet the rising demand.
tsn: re okeditse tekanyetsokabo ya sekema sa thuso ya matlole a baithuti sa bosetšhaba go ya go r9 bilione go fitlhelela tlhokego e e oketsegang.

eng: another major achievement of this term has been the establishment of two brand new universities, sol plaatje in the northern cape and the university of mpumalanga.
tsn: phitlhelelo e nngwe e kgolo ya paka eno ke go tlhamiwa ga diyunibesithi tse pedi tse dintšhwa, e leng sol plaatje kwa kapa bokone le yunibesithi ya mpumalanga.

eng: we will also build 12 new fet colleges in limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal and eastern cape.
tsn: re tla aga gape dikholetšhe tse dintšhwa tsa fet kwa limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natala le kapa botlhaba.

eng: compatriots,the launch of the national education collaboration framework last year was an important development for the country.
tsn: go tlhomiwa ga letlhomeso la bosetšhaba la tirisanommogo ya thuto ngogola e nnile tiragalo ya botlhokwa mo nageng.

eng: we wish the team well in their national duty.
tsn: re eleletsa setlhopha masego mo tirong ya sona ya bosetšhaba.

eng: over the past five years, 300 new health facilities have been built, including 160 new clinics.
tsn: mo dingwageng di le tlhano tse di fetileng, go agilwe ditheo tse dintšhwa tsa boitekanelo di le 300, go akarediwa le ditleleniki tse dintšhwa di le 160. dipetlele tse dintšhwa di le lesome di agilwe kgotsa di ntšhwafadtswe kwa ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, kgaolo ya vryburg, swartruggens, khayelitsha le mitchell’s plain.

eng: ten new hospitals have been builtor refurbished in ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, vryburg district, swartruggens, khayelitsha and mitchell’s plain.
tsn: mmusakgotla yo o tlotlegangmodulasetilo yo o tlotlegang wa ncoptokafalo mo hiv le aids ke nngwe ya diphitlhelelo tse dikgolo go gaisa tsa tsamaiso eno mme mananeo a ditšhabakopano a aids (unaids) a re dirisa jaaka naga ya sekao.

eng: honourable speakerhonourable chairperson of the ncopthe hiv and aids turnaround is one of the biggest achievements of this administration and we are used as a model country by the united nations aids programmes, (unaids).
tsn: tshwaetso ya hiv go tswa go mme go ya go ngwana e fokotsegile thata mme re okeditse palo ya batho ba ba amogelang kalafi ya dianthiretrobaerale gabedi, go tswa go batho ba le milione o le mongwe go ya go ba le dimilione di le 2.4 ka 2013. maaforika borwa a feta dimilione di le 20 a dirile teko ya hiv fa e sale go tlhomiwa letsholo ka 2011 mme seo ke sesupo sa go ikanya tsamaiso ya boitekanelo.

eng: life expectancy is now firmly on an upward trend.
tsn: dingwaga tsa go tshela jaanong di tlhatloga ka tsepamo.

eng: south africans are now living longer.
tsn: maaforika a tshela sebaka se seleele jaanong.

eng: the target for the next administration is to ensure that at least 4.6 million people are enrolled in the anti-retroviral programme.
tsn: diphitlhelelo tsa tsamaiso e e latelang e tshwanetse go nna go netefatsa gore bonnye batho ba le dimilione di le 4.6 ba kwadisiwa mo lenaneong la dianthiretrobaerale.

eng: we acknowledge the contribution of the south african national aids council for the hard work.
tsn: re lebogela tshwaelo ya lekgotla la aforika borwa la bosetšhaba la aids ka go dira ka natla.

eng: while celebrating our success, we must not be complacent.
tsn: le fa re keteka katlego ya rona, ga re a tshwanela go itebala.

eng: the prevention work must still continue so that we can reach that goal of zero hiv infections sooner.
tsn: tiro ya go thibela e tshwanetse go tswelela pele ka bonako gore re kgone go fitlhelela phitlhelelo ya gore go se ke ga tlhola go nna le tshwaetso ya hiv.

eng: at a broader level, we will enter a new phase in the implementation of the national health insurance programme which will extend quality healthcare to the poor.
tsn: ka kakaretso, re tla tsena mo legatong le lentšhwa la tiragatso ya lenaneo la inšorense ya bosetšhaba ya boitekanelo e e tla atolosetsang tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ya boleng kwa bahumaneging.

eng: honourable chairperson of the ncop,honourable speakerthe overall crime rate has decreased by 21 percent since 2002 and work is ongoing to make communities safer.
tsn: modulasetilo yo o tlotlegang wa ncop,mmusakgotla yo o tlotlegangseelo sa bosenyi ka kakaretso se fokotsegile ka 21% go tloga ka 2002 mme tiro ya go dira gore baagi ba nne ba babalesegile e tswelela pele.

eng: one of the key focus areas is to eradicate violence against women and children.
tsn: nngwe ya dintlha tsa botlhokwa tse di totilweng ke go fedisa tirisodikgoka kgatlhanong le basadi le bana.

eng: we have introduced a number of measures to respond to this challenge.
tsn: re itsisitse dikgato di le mmalwa go tsibogela kgwetlho eno.

eng: these include the reopening of the family violence, child protection and sexual offences units as well as the sexual offences courts.
tsn: tsona di akaretsa go bulwa gape ga diyuniti tsa tirisodikgoka ya mo malapeng, tshireletso ya bana le melato ya thobalano mmogo le dikgotlatshekelo tsa melato ya thobalano.

eng: we thank the many ngos that promote the rights of women and children who contribute positively to this important work.
tsn: re leboga mekgatlho e e seng ya puso e e mentsi e e tsweletsang ditshwanelo tsa basadi le bana tse di tshwaelang mo tirong eno e e botlhokwa.

eng: our country continues to be the target of rhino poachers.
tsn: naga ya rona e tswelapele go totiwa ke magodu a dinaka tsa ditshukudu.

eng: our law enforcement agencies are working hard to arrest this scourge.
tsn: ditheo tsa rona tsa tiragatso ya molao di dira ka natla go fedisa bosula jono.

eng: we have also reached agreements with china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique and other sadc countries to work together to stop this crime.
tsn: gape re na le ditumelano le dinaga tsa china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique le tsa dinaga tsa mokgatlho wa tlhabololo ya borwa jwa aforika (sadc) go dira mmogo go fedisa bosenyi jono.

eng: we thank the business community and all south africans who participate in the campaign to save the rhino.
tsn: re leboga bagwebi le maaforika borwa otlhe a a nnang le seabe mo letsholong la go boloka ditshukudu.

eng: compatriotsthe independence of the judiciary has been further enhanced by the establishment of the office of the chief justice as a separate institution from the department of justice and constitutional development.
tsn: bakaulengwekemonosi ya boatlhodi e tokafaditswe gape ka go tlhamiwa ga kantoro ya moatlhodimogolo jaaka setheo se se ikemetseng go tswa mo lefapheng la bosiamisi le tlhabololo ya molaotheo.

eng: we have passed several pieces of legislation to support this new role of the office of the chief justice.
tsn: re fetisitse melao e le mmalwa go tshegetsa seabe seno se sentšhwa sa kantoro ya moatlhodimogolo.

eng: progress is being made in the transformation of the judiciary to reflect the race and gender demographics of the country.
tsn: go na le tswelelopele mo go fetoleng boatlhodi gore bo bontshe merafe le bong jo bo farologaneng mo nageng.

eng: the chief justice of the republic continues to champion and lead this transformation.
tsn: moatlhodimogolo wa rephaboliki o tswelapele go etelela pele diphetogo tseno.

eng: black judges (african, indian and coloured) now constitute 61% of all judges.
tsn: ga jaanong baatlhodi ba bantsho (maaforika, maindia le bammala) ba dira 61% ya baatlhodi botlhe.

eng: however, the acute under-representation of women on the bench remains of concern.
tsn: fela kemedi e e kwa tlase ya basadi mo boatlhoding e sa ntse e le ntlha e e tshwenyang.

eng: of the judicial establishment of 239 judges, only 76 are women.
tsn: mo baatlhoding ba le 239, ke ba le 76 fela ba e leng basadi.

eng: the challenge is to transform the legal profession broadly in order to nourish the pool from which female judges can be appointed.
tsn: kgwetlho ke go dira diphetogo mo porofešeneng ya molao ka kakaretso gore go nonotshiwe setlhopha se baatlhodi ba basadi ba ka thapiwang go tswa mo go sona.

eng: the finalisation of the legal practice bill will assist to broaden the pool from which potential judicial officers could be selected.
tsn: go konosediwa ga molaotlhomo wa tiragatso ya molao go tla thusa go atolosa setlhopha se batlhankedi ba boatlhodi ba ka tlhophiwang go tswa mo go sona.

eng: honourable speaker and chairperson,south africans are united in wanting a corruption free society.
tsn: mmusakgotla le modulasetilo ba ba tlotlegang,maaforika borwa a mmogo mo go batleng gore go se ke ga nna le bobodu mo baaging.

eng: fighting corruption within the public service is yielding results.
tsn: go lwantsha bobodu mo tirelongsetšhaba go ungwa maungo.

eng: since the launch of the national anti-corruption hotline by the public service commission, over 13 000 cases of corruption and maladministration have been referred to government departments for further handling and investigation.
tsn: fa e sa le khomišene ya tirelosetšhaba e tlhoma mogala wa bosetšhaba wa twantshobobodu, go setse go fetiseditswe dikgetse di feta 13 000 tsa bobodu le tsamaiso e e sokameng kwa mafapheng a puso gore di sekasekwe le go batlisisiwa.

eng: government has recovered more than 320-million rand from perpetrators through the national anti-corruption hotline.
tsn: puso e boetswe ke madi a feta r320 milione go tswa mo basenying ka thuso ya tiriso ya mogala wa bosetšhaba wa twantshobobodu.

eng: some of the successes of the national anti-corruption hotline include the following:to prevent corruption in the supply chain system, government has decided to establish a central tender board to adjudicate tenders in all spheres of government.
tsn: dikatlego dingwe tsa mogala wa bosetšhaba wa twantshobobodu di akaretsa tse di latelang:go thibela bobodu mo tsamaisong ya tlamelo ya ditirelo le dithoto, puso e sweditse go tlhama boto ya dithendara ya bogareng go atlhola dithendara mo magatong otlhe a puso.

eng: this body will work with the chief procurement officer whose main function will be to check on pricing and adherence to procedures as well as fairness.
tsn: setheo seno se tla dira le motlhankedimogolo wa ditheko yo tiro ya gagwe e kgolo e tla nnang go sekaseka ditlhotlhwa le kobamelo ya ditsamaiso mmogo le go tila kgobelelo.

eng: the special investigating unit is investigating maladministration or alleged corruption in a number of government departments and state entities, through 40 proclamations signed by the president during this administration.
tsn: yuniti e e kgethegileng ya dipatlisiso e batlisisa tsamaiso e e sokameng gongwe bobodu jo bo begilweng mo mafapheng a le mmalwa a puso le ditheo tsa mmuso, ka dikgoeletso di le 40 tse di saenilweng ke moporesidente mo tsamaisong eno.

eng: we will keep the public informed of the outcome of the investigations.
tsn: re tla nna re begela setšhaba ka dipoelo tsa dipatlisiso.

eng: in the first six months of last year, the asset forfeiture unit paid a total of 149 million rand into the criminal assets recovery account and to the victims of crime.
tsn: mo dikgweding di le thataro tsa ntlha tsa ngogola, yuniti ya thopo ya dithoto e duetse bokana ka r149 milione mo akhaontong ya pusetso ya dithoto tsa bosenyi le kwa batswasetlhabelong ba bosenyi.

eng: this is 170% above its target of 55 million rand and is higher than it has ever achieved in a full year.
tsn: seno ke 170% go feta phitlhelelo e e neng e ipeetswe ya r55 mme ke e e kwa godimo go gaisa e e kileng ya e fitlhelela mo ngwageng o o tletseng.

eng: last year, the competition authorities investigated large-scale price fixing in the construction industry and fined guilty companies 1.4 billion rand.
tsn: ngogola, bothati jwa dikgaisano bo batlisisitse go tsepamisiwa ga ditlhotlhwa go go boitshegang mo indasetering ya dikago mme ya lefisa ditlamo tse di molato r1.4 bilione.

eng: further steps against those involved are now underway.
tsn: ga jaanong go tsweletswe ka dikgato tse dingwe kgatlhanong le ba ba amegang.

eng: compatriots,i would now like to touch briefly on the provision of basic services to our people.
tsn: jaanong ke rata go ama ka boripana ntlha ya go tlamela batho ba rona ka ditirelo tsa motheo.

eng: over the past 20 years, remarkable achievements have been made in increasing access to services such as water, sanitation and electricity.
tsn: mo dingwageng di le 20 tse di fetileng, go nnile le diphitlhelelo tse di gaisang tsa go oketsa phitlhelesego ya ditirelo di tshwana le metsi, kgelelo ya leswe mmogo le motlakase.

eng: government has begun an intensive programme to eliminate the bucket system as part of restoring the dignity of our people.
tsn: puso e simolotse lenaneo le le maatla la go fedisa tsamaiso ya matlwana a dikgamelo jaaka karolo ya go busetsa seriti sa batho ba rona.

eng: phase one of the programme will eradicate buckets in formalized townships of the free state, eastern cape and northern cape.
tsn: legato la ntlha la lenaneo le tla fedisa dikgamelo kwa metsesetoropong e e mo molaong ya foreisetata, kapa botlhaba le kapa bokone.

eng: phase two will eradicate buckets in informal settlements in all provinces.
tsn: legato la bobedi le tla fedisa dikgamelo kwa mafelong a a seng mo molaong mo diporofenseng tsotlhe.

eng: in housing, about 3 million housing units and more than 855 thousand serviced sites were delivered since 1994. nearly 500 informal settlements have been replaced with quality housing and basic services over the past five years.
tsn: malebana le dintlo, go tlametswe ka madulo a dintlo di ka nna 3 milione le ditsha tse di nang le ditirelo di feta 855 000 go tloga ka 1994. mafelo a a seng mo molaong a ka nna 500 a agetswe dintlo tsa boleng le ditirelo tsa motheo mo dingwageng di le tlhano tse di fetileng.

eng: the next administration will promote better located mixed income housing projects.
tsn: puso e e latelang e tla tsweletsa diporojeke tse di mo mafelong a a botoka tsa dintlo tsa lotseno lo lo tlhakaneng.

eng: compatriots,some communities still do not have these services especially in informal settlements and rural areas.
tsn: baagi bangwe ba sa ntse ba se na ditirelo tseno, bogolo segolo kwa mafelong a a seng mo molaong le kwa metseselegae.

eng: we are therefore working with all spheres of government to ensure the provision of these services, especially in the 23 municipalities with the greatest number of backlogs.
tsn: ka jalo, re dira le maphata otlhe a puso go netefatsa gore go tlamelwa ka ditirelo tseno, bogolo segolo kwa makgotlatoropong a le 23 a a nang le palo e e kwa godimo ya tshalelo morago.

eng: compatriotsin last year’s state of the nation address, i raised my concern with the manifestation of violence in some of the protests taking place in our country.
tsn: bakaulengwemo puong ya ngogola ya sona, ke tlhagisitse matshwenyego malebana le tirisodikgoka e e bonalang mo ditshupetsong dingwe tse di diragalang mo nageng ya rona.

eng: violent protests have taken place again around the country in the past few weeks.
tsn: go nnile le ditshupetso tsa tirisodikgoka gape go ralala naga mo dibekeng di le mmalwa tse di fetileng.

eng: also worrying is what appears to be premeditated violence, as is the case with the use of petrol bombs and other weapons during protests.
tsn: se se tshwenyang gape ke se se lebegang e le tirisodikgoka e e rulagantsweng, jaaka go bonagetse ka tiriso ya dibomo tsa petorolo mmogo le dibetsa tse dingwe mo ditshupetsong.

eng: the democratic government supports the right of citizens to express themselves.
tsn: puso ya temokerasi e tshegetsa tshwanelo ya baagi ya go tlhagisa maikutlo a bona.

eng: the right to protest, peacefully and unarmed, is enshrined in the constitution.
tsn: tshwanelo ya go dira ditshupetso ka kagiso, kwa ntle ga dibetsa, e sireleditswe mo molaotheong.

eng: however, when protests threaten lives and property and destroy valuable infrastructure intended to serve the community, they undermine the very democracy that upholds the right to protest.
tsn: fela, fa ditshupetso di tshosetsa matshelo le dithoto mme di senya mafaratlhatlha a botlhokwa a maikaelelo a ona e leng go direla baagi, di nyatsa temokerasi e e tsweletsang tshwanelo ya go dira ditshupetso.

eng: the dominant narrative in the case of the protests in south africa has been to attribute them to alleged failures of government.
tsn: puo e e tletsetletseng mo ntlheng ya ditshupetso mo aforika borwa e nnile ya gore di bakwa ke go retelelwa ga puso.

eng: however the protests are not simply the result of “failures” of government but also of the success in delivering basic services.
tsn: fela ditshupetso tse ga di fela ka ntlha ya "go retelelwa" ga puso mme gape di ka ga katlego ya go tlamela ditirelo tsa motheo.

eng: when 95% of households have access to water, the 5% who still need to be provided for, feel they cannot wait a moment longer.
tsn: fa 95% ya magae e fitlhelela metsi, 5% e e sa ntseng e tshwanetse e tlamelwe, e ikutlwa gore e ka se lete go feta foo.

eng: success is also the breeding ground of rising expectations.
tsn: katlego gape e kgona go tsala ditsholofelo.

eng: let me also add honourable members, that any loss of life at the hands of the police in the course of dealing with the protests cannot be overlooked or condoned.
tsn: nte ke tlaleletse gape ditokololo tse di tlotlegang, gore tatlhegelo ya botshelo mo diatleng tsa sepodisi ka nako ya go samagana le ditshupetso, e ka seke ya tlodisiwa matlho le fa e le go tlhotlhelediwa.

eng: loss of life is not a small matter.
tsn: tatlhegelo ya botshelo ga se matshamekwane.

eng: we need to know what happened, why it happened.
tsn: re tshwanetse go itse gore go diragetse eng, le gore goreng se diragetse.

eng: any wrongdoing must be dealt with and corrective action must be taken.
tsn: go tshwanetse ga samaganwa le phoso nngwe le nngwe mme ga tsewa dikgato tsa go lolamisa.

eng: police must act within the ambit of the law at all times.
tsn: mapodisi a tshwanetse go dira go ya ka molao ka dinako tsotlhe.

eng: having said this, we should also as a society be concerned that between 2005 and 2013, close to 800 police officerswere killed.
tsn: ke sa ntse ke le foo, re tshwanetse gape jaaka batho re tshwenngwe ke gore magareng ga 2005 le 2013, go bolailwe mapodisi a ka nna 800. mapodisi ke basireletsi mme ke thebe e e magareng ga baagi ba ba tshelang go ya ka molao mo temokerasing, le tlhakatlhakano.

eng: the police are protectors and are the buffer between a democratic society based on the rule of law, and anarchy.
tsn: a e re fa re rwesa mapodisi maikarabelo, re ele tlhoke gore re se ke ra iphitlhela re ba nyatsa mme re galaletsa tlhakatlhakano mo baaging ba rona.

eng: we need to conduct anintrospectionin our efforts to get rid of this scourge.
tsn: re tshwanetse go itshekatsheka mo maitekong a rona go fedisa bosula jo.

eng: as leaders from all walks of life, we must reflect on what we did or did not do, to systematically root out the violence that surfaced in protests during the early days of our democracy.
tsn: jaaka baeteledipele botlhe fela, re tshwanetse go lebelela gore ke eng se re se dirileng gongwe se re sa se dirang, go tomola tirisodikgoka e e tlhageletseng mo ditshupetsong mo malatsing a ntlha a temokerasi ya rona.

eng: we have a collective responsibility to build a society that respects the rule of law, respects one another and which respects life and property.
tsn: re na le maikarabelo a a tlhakanetsweng a go aga setšhaba se se tlotlang molao, se tlotlana e bile se tlotla botshelo le dithoto.

eng: we should work together to rebuild ubuntu and a culture of responsibility in our society.
tsn: re tshwanetse go dira mmogo go aga ubuntu sešwa mmogo le mokgwa o o boikarabelo mo setšhabeng sa rona.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,a decision has been taken to improve functioning of local government.
tsn: mmusakgotla yo o tlotlegang,modulasetilo yo o tlotlegang wa ncop,go tserwe tshwetso ya go tokafatsa go dira ga pusoselegae.

eng: the amendment of the municipal systems act is intended to improve the capacity of municipalities to deliver services.
tsn: maikemisetso a paakanyo ya molao wa dithulaganyo tsa makgotlatoropo ke go tokafatsa bokgoni jwa makgotlatoropo jwa go tlamela ka ditirelo.

eng: qualified and experienced personnel must be deployed in municipalities.
tsn: go tshwanetse ga romelwa badiri ba ba nang le borutegi le maitemogelo kwa makgotlatoropong.

eng: we also need to strengthen existing forums of people’s participation and enable our people to play a greater role in development.
tsn: re tlhoka gape go maatlafatsa diforamo tse di gona tsa seabe sa batho le go kgontsha batho ba rona go nna le seabe se segolwane mo ditlhabololong.

eng: the fight against corruption must be intensified as well, especially given reports that some services are interrupted or stopped, so that certain people could provide those services at cost to the state.
tsn: go tshwanetse ga maatlafadiwa le ntwa kgatlhanong le bobodu, bogolo segolo go lebeletswe dipego tsa gore ditirelo dingwe di a kgorelediwa le go emisiwa gore batho bangwe ba tle ba tlamele ka ditirelo tseo ka ditshenyegelo go mmuso.

eng: these matters are being prioritised for the next administration.
tsn: dintlha tseno di beilwe jaaka ditlapele tsa puso e e latelang.

eng: honourable speaker and chairpersondemocratic south africa’s foreign policy was shaped many decades ago during the fierce international campaign to isolate the apartheid state.
tsn: mmusakgotla le modulasetilo ba ba tlotlegangpholisi ya aforika borwa wa temokerasi ya merero ya dinaga di sele e sale e betlilwe dingwagasome di le mmalwa tse di fetileng ka letsholo le le maatla la boditšhabatšhaba la go tlhaola mmuso wa tlhaolele.

eng: anc president oliver tambo played a key role in that regard, assisted by among others, the late johnny makatini, former head of international affairs.
tsn: moporesidente wa anc, oliver tambo o nnile le seabe sa botlhokwa mo ntlheng eo, a thuswa gareng ga ba bangwe, ke moswi johnny makatini, e leng tlhogo ya maloba ya merero ya boditšhabatšhaba.

eng: his wife, mrs valerie makatini is one of our honoured guests this evening.
tsn: mosadi wa gagwe, mohumagadi valerie makatini ke mongwe wa baeng ba rona ba tlotlego maitseboeng ano.

eng: africa has remained at the centre of our foreign policy.
tsn: aforika e sa ntse e le mooko wa pholisi ya rona ya dinaga di sele.

eng: we have worked hard to strengthen support for the african union, sadc and all continental bodies whose purpose is to achieve peace and security.
tsn: re dirile ka natla go maatlafatsa tshegetso ya tshwaragano ya aforika, sadc mmogo le ditheo tsotlhe tsa kontinente tse maikemisetso a tsona e leng go fitlhelela kagiso le tshireletsego.

eng: we have also prioritised the promotion of regional economic integration, infrastructure development, intra-african trade and sustainable development in the continent.
tsn: gape re dirile tsweletso ya kgokaganyo ya ikonomi ya kgaolo, tlhabololo ya mafaratlhatlha, kgwebisano ya mo gare ga aforika mmogo le tlhabololo e e nnelang leruri mo kontinenteng go nna ditlapele.

eng: this year we also submitted our third country report to the au african peer review mechanism which was well received.
tsn: monongwaga re tlhagisitse gape le pegelo ya rona ya boraro ya naga kwa setheong sa au sa tshekatsheko ya balekane ba aforika eo e amogetsweng ka diatla tsoopedi.

eng: we continue to support peacemaking and conflict resolution.
tsn: re tswelela go tshegetsa go dira kagiso le go rarabolola dikgotlhang.

eng: progress is being made in negotiations between sudan and south sudan on outstanding issues following the secession.
tsn: go na le tswelelopele mo dipuisanong magareng ga sudan le sudanborwa malebana le dintlha tse di saletseng morago go latela kemiso.

eng: following requests from sri lanka and south sudan for assistance in bringing about peace and reconciliation, mr cyril ramaphosa, has been appointed as south africa’s special envoy to the two countries.
tsn: go latela kopo ya thuso ya go tlisa kagiso le poelano go tswa go sri lanka le sudanborwa, rre cyril ramaphosa o thapilwe jaaka moemedi yo o kgethegileng wa aforika borwa go ya kwa dinageng ka bobedi pedi.

eng: his expertise in conflict resolution and negotiations as well as our country’s experience in this regard, will greatly assist the two countries to resolve their problems.
tsn: bokgoni jwa gagwe jwa dipuisano le go rarabolola dikgotlhang mmogo le maitemogelo a naga ya rona mo ntlheng eno, di tla thusa thata dinaga tseno tse pedi mo go rarabololeng mathata a tsona.

eng: we will continue to strengthen relations with europe, north america, latin america, asia and countries in the south.
tsn: re tla tswelapele go maatlafatsa botsalano le yuropa, amerikabokone, amerika wa latini, asia mmogo le dinaga tse di kwa borwa.

eng: participation in international multilateral forums such as the g20 have been beneficial for the country.
tsn: go nna le seabe mo diforamong tsa maphatamantsi tsa boditšhabatšhaba go tshwana le g20 go nnile mosola mo nageng.

eng: and joining the brazil, russia, india and china (bric) group in december 2010 counts as among the key achievements of the fourth administration.
tsn: mme go tsenela setlhopha sa brazil, russia, india le china (bric) ka sedimonthole wa 2010 go balelwa mo diphitlhelelong tse dikgolo tsa puso ya bone.

eng: it was also a great honour to host the fifth brics summit on 27 march 2013 in durban, which saw the participation of african leaders to discuss developmental cooperation with brics.
tsn: gape re nnile motlotlo go amogela samiti ya botlhano ya brics ka la bo 27 mopitlwe 2013 kwa durban, koo go nnileng le seabe sa baeteledipele ba aforika ba ba neng ba buisanela tirisanommogo ya ditlhabololo le brics.

eng: we will continue to serve diligently in the united nations in promotion of strong international governance.
tsn: re tla tswelela go dira ka maatlametlo kwa ditšhabakopano go tsweletsa puso e e maatla ya boditšhabatšhaba.

eng: we will also continue promoting the reform of the un security council and global financial institutions.
tsn: re tla tswelela go tsweletsa diphetogo tsa lekgotla la tshireletso la un le ditheo tsa ditšhelete tsa lefatshe.

eng: honourable membersas president of the cop17/cmp7 united nations climate change conference which was hosted in durban in 2011, south africa successfully placed the world on an unassailable course, through the adoption of the durban platform for enhanced action.
tsn: ditokololo tse di tlotlegangjaaka moporesidente wa khonferense ya ditšhabakopano ya phetogo ya tlelaemete ya cop17/cmp7 e e neng e tshwaretswe kwa durban ka 2011, aforika borwa e beile lefatshe mo tseleng e e ka se ganediweng, ka go amogelwa ga motheo wa kgato e e tokafetseng ya durban.

eng: compatriots,over the past 20 years we have hosted a number of international sporting and cultural visits, which has helped to boost social cohesion and unity.
tsn: bakaulengwe,mo dingwageng di le 20 tse di fetileng re amogetse maeto a le mmalwa a metshameko le setso, a a thusitseng go rotloetsa tirisanommogo ya loago le tshwaragano.

eng: in the past five years, south africa hosted the highly successful 2010 fifa soccer world cup and other key soccer, rugby and cricket tournament, which left a tangible feeling of pride and unity among all south africans.
tsn: mo dingwageng di le tlhano tse di fetileng, aforika borwa e amogetse sejana sa lefatshe sa kgwele ya dinao sa fifa 2010 mmogo le dithonamente tse dingwe tsa botlhokwa tsa kgwele ya dinao, rakabii mmogo le khirikete, tse di tlogetseng maikutlo a a utlwalang a boipelo le tshwaragano magareng ga maaforika borwa otlhe.

eng: as we celebrate 20 years of freedom, we will do so having done well in building a new heritage landscape for our country.
tsn: jaaka re keteka dingwaga di le 20 tsa kgololesego, re tla dira jalo re dirile sentle go agela naga ya rona boalo jo bontšhwa jwa ngwaoboswa.

eng: a number of new museums and monuments were established, including the statue of former president mandela which has become a landmark in the union buildings.
tsn: go tlhamilwe dimusiamo le dimonyumente di le mmalwa, go akarediwa sefikantswe sa moporesidente wa maloba mandela, se jaanong e leng letshwao le legolo kwa union building.

eng: more than 2000 geographical names have been changed in order to correct the ill-naming of places, as well as to give communities the right to determine the names of their areas.
tsn: maina a mafelo a feta 2 000 a fetotswe go siamisa go tewa maina go go sa siamang ga mafelo, mmogo le go naya baagi tshwanelo ya go swetsa ka maina a mafelo a bona.

eng: honourable membersallow me to acknowledge some of our compatriots who are making their mark in the world.
tsn: ditokololo tse di tlotlegangntetleng go leboga bangwe ba bakaulengwe ba rona ba ba itirelang maina mo lefatsheng.

eng: we congratulate ladysmith black mambazo on winning their fourth grammy award last month.
tsn: re akgola ladysmith black mambazo ka go gapa sekgele sa bona sa bone sa grammy kgwedi e e fetileng.

eng: we welcome the group leader, mr joseph shabalala, one of our guests this evening.
tsn: re amogela moeteledipele wa setlhopha, rre joseph shabalala, mongwe wa baeng ba rona phirimaneng eno.

eng: we also acknowledge ms yvonne chaka chaka who is one of our guests this evening.
tsn: re amogela gape mme yvonne chaka chaka yo e leng mongwe wa baeng ba rona phirimaneng eno.

eng: she is doing a lot of good work as the united nations children’s fund goodwill ambassador for malaria in africa and also the united nations millennium development goals special envoy for africa.
tsn: o dira tiro e e ntle thata jaaka moemedi wa bomolemo wa malaria wa letlole la bana la ditšhabakopano le moemedi yo o kgethegileng wa aforika wa diphitlhelelo tsa mileniamo tsa tlhabololo ya ditšhabakopano.

eng: ms chaka chaka was also honoured with the crystal award by the world economic forum in davos for her humanitarian work.
tsn: gape mme chaka chaka o tlotlilwe ka sekgele sa crystal ke foramo ya ikonomi ya lefatshe kwa davos ka ntlha ya tiro ya gagwe ya bopelonomi.

eng: we also recognise, in her absence, our oscar award-winning hollywood star, ms charlize theron.
tsn: re lemoga gape mofenyi wa rona wa sekgele sa oscar, le fa a seyo, mme charlize theron.

eng: ms theron is also the un messenger for peace.
tsn: mme theron gape ke morongwa wa un wa kagiso.

eng: she also champions the fight against aids especially amongst the youth and young women.
tsn: gape o eteletse pele ntwa kgatlhanong le aids, bogolo segolo mo bašweng le makgarejana.

eng: she was also honoured by the world economic forum with a crystal award.
tsn: gape o tlotlilwe ke foramo ya ikonomi ya lefatshe ka sekgele sa crystal.

eng: compatriotsyou would have noticed that in this sona we have given a report of the past five yearsin particular and over the past 20 years in general.
tsn: le ka ne le lemogile gore mo sona eno, re tlhagisitse pegelo e e totileng dingwaga di le tlhano tse di fetileng le ya dingwaga tse di fetileng di le 20 ka kakaretso.

eng: this is not an occasion to present the programme of action for this financial year.
tsn: seno ga se tiragalo ya go tlhagisa lenaneo la dikgato tsa ngwaga ono wa ditšhelete.

eng: that programme will be presented by the new government after the elections.
tsn: lenaneo leo le tla tlhagisiwa ke puso e ntšhwa morago ga ditlhopho.

eng: to prepare for that first state of the nation address by the incoming administration later in the year, we have over the past year, been working on a medium term strategic framework.
tsn: go baakanyetsa puo ya ntlha ya maemo a setšhaba ya tsamaiso e e tlang pejana mo ngwageng, mo ngwageng o o fetileng, re ntse re baakanya letlhomeso la togamaano la pakagare.

eng: the framework has been designed as the first five year building block of the national development plan, from 2014 to 2019. it also incorporates key targets of the industrial policy action plan, the new growth path and infrastructure plan.
tsn: letlhomeso le rulagantswe go nna motheo wa kago wa dingwaga tsa ntlha tse tlhano wa ndp, go tloga ka 2014 go ya go 2019. gape le akaretsa diphitlhelelo tsa botlhokwa tse di totilweng tsa leano la tiragatso ya pholesi ya indaseteri, tsela e ntšhwa ya kgolo mmogo le leano la mafaratlhatlha.

eng: the intention is to table the draft framework to the first cabinet lekgotla after the elections.
tsn: maikemisetso ke go tlhagisa letlhomesotlhomo kwa lekgotleng la ntlha la kabinete morago ga ditlhopho.

eng: it will be refined by the new administration in line with its electoral mandate, so that work can start as soon as possible after the formation of a new government.
tsn: le tla baakanngwa ke tsamaiso e ntšhwa go ya ka thomo ya yona ya batlhophi, gore tiro e simolole ka bonako jo bo tla kgonegang morago ga go tlhamiwa ga puso e ntšhwa.

eng: it has been an honour for my administration and i to build on the foundation laid by the first three democratic administrations, to serve the people of south africa.
tsn: gape e nnile tlotla mo go nna le mo bobusing jwa me go agelela mo motheong o o tlhomilweng ke dipuso tsa ntlha tse tharo tsa temokerasi, go direla batho ba aforika borwa.

eng: as a country we have scored many successes.
tsn: jaaka naga re fitlheletse dikatlego di le dintsi.

eng: south africa is a much better place to live in now than it was before 1994. we continue to face challenges.
tsn: aforika borwa ke lefelo le le botoka tota go nna mo go lona go feta jaaka e ne e ntse pele ga 1994. re tswelapele go lebagana le dikgwetlho.

eng: but life will also continue to change for the better.
tsn: fela botshelo bo tswetsepele go fetoga go nna botoka.

eng: nkosi sikelel’ i africagod bless afrika.
tsn: nkosi sikelel’ i africagod bless afrika.

eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop,deputy president of the republic, honourable cyril ramaphosa,former deputy president kgalema motlanthe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary,honourable ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures,chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership,chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,the heads of chapter 9 institutions,leaders from all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps,honourable members,distinguished guestsfellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, riperile, dumelang, ndi madekwana.
